And I was wondering that could is there a way to make the FF quantum version do the same since I have try it and i find it cumbersome to use, since when I try the drag and highlight FF not allowed me to and the way to highlight is as if I am using a smartphone could you fix it ? And the way the when I try to refresh the webpage in the quantum when I click the address bar and enter it not working could you fix it?

title: Last Pass Add-In error connecting
content:
Firefox Release 85.0.1, February 5, 2021 on Windows 10 computer

I uninstalled the Last Pass Add-in, cleared Cookies, and then downloaded and reinstalled the Last Pass add-in with the same result, yellow box for Last Pass, after I log-in. I received the following message after I tried to login: “We couldn't contact the server. Check your internet connection and try again”.

However, I am connected to the internet and if I try to connect to Last Pass outside of though the Firefox Add In, I do not get any error

If I click and delete the error message, the icon turns to red, which is normal.
creator: ksb1

title: Unable to access Hulu account
content: I have been unable to access my Hulu account on my Macbook since I switched to using Firefox. I have followed online instructions and it shows access to my location is allowed but I cannot get to the log-in page without a block asking me for permission for Hulu to have my location.

title: New Menu Bar
content:
How do I get rid of the new menu bar that displays links/icons for "Getting Started" "Customer Portal" and "Other Bookmarks"? As they needlessly take up screen real estate. I guess they came as part of a recent update, but I find them to be a useless and redundant theft of screen real estate. Can someone please tell me how to rid my FF browser of it?

I am using FF85 (64-bit) on a 64-bit PC with Windows Home 10 64-bit.

Thank you,

Charlie
creator: caktusman

title: <time> tag in HTML
content:
How does Firefox deal with the HTML <date> and <time> tags, especially <time> with datetime= attribute? Definitions of the tag say this about the datetime= attribute: "The datetime attribute of this element is used to translate the time into a machine-readable format so that browsers can offer to add date reminders through the user's calendar..." (ellipsis mine).

I don't see anything special happening with this tag when I open a web page that has them. There isn't anything done by Firefox that I can see, so I'm wondering if it just allows the tags but doesn't process them.
creator: TimHare

title: Cannot open a website that I use daily
content: As of yesterday I can no longer open my golf course web site using Firefox. I can open it using Chrome and Edge but not using Firefox
